entities.description: "DS-DST model is the proposed dual strategy model for Dialogue State Tracking (DST), utilizing BERT for encoding and slot gate classification."
"Devlin et al., 2019 are the authors associated with the pre-trained BERT model used in the DS-DST model."
"Wu et al., 2019 are referenced for their work on slot gate classification in multidomain dialogues."
"Xu and Hu, 2018 are referenced for their work on slot gate classification in the context of the DS-DST model."
"BERT is a pre-trained model used in the DS-DST model for encoding information about the dialogue context and each domain-slot pair."
"Dialogue Context refers to the conversation history up to a certain turn, denoted as $X_t$, which includes pairs of system and user utterances."
"Domain-Slot Pairs are the combinations of domains and slots being discussed in the dialogue, represented as ${\cal S}$."
"Non-Categorical Slots are domain-slot pairs treated as non-categorical, utilizing a two-way linear mapping to find text spans."
"Categorical Slots are domain-slot pairs treated as categorical, selecting the most plausible values from the picklists based on contextual representation."
"Picklist refers to the list of possible candidate values for each categorical slot, denoted as $\{V_{1},\ldots,V_{L}\}$."
"Slot Gate is a classification module designed to predict the appearance of domain-slot pairs at each turn of the dialogue."
"Multidomain Dialogues are dialogues that involve multiple domains, making the prediction of domain-slot pairs more complex."

relationships.description: "The DS-DST model utilizes the pre-trained BERT model by Devlin et al., 2019 for encoding dialogue context and domain-slot pairs."
"The DS-DST model follows the slot gate classification approach by Wu et al., 2019 for predicting domain-slot pair appearances in dialogue turns."
"The DS-DST model is influenced by the work of Xu and Hu, 2018 in designing its slot gate classification module."
"BERT encodes the dialogue context to obtain contextualized representations for domain-slot pairs."
"BERT encodes each domain-slot pair to obtain contextualized representations conditioned on the domain-slot information."
"Non-Categorical Slots and Categorical Slots are two different types of domain-slot pairs handled differently in the DS-DST model."
"Categorical Slots select the most plausible values from the picklist based on the contextual representation."
"Slot Gate classifies whether a domain-slot pair appears at each turn of the dialogue, playing a crucial role in DST."
"The complexity of multidomain dialogues necessitates the use of a slot gate to predict domain-slot pair appearances accurately."

entities.description: "BERT is a pre-trained model used as a feature extractor in the described model architecture for slot-value prediction tasks."
"MultiWOZ 2.0 is an event or dataset referenced in the text, which contains dialogues used for training and evaluation in the domain-slot prediction model."
"MultiWOZ 2.1 is an event or dataset referenced in the text, which is an updated version of MultiWOZ 2.0 and contains dialogues for the domain-slot prediction model."
"Domain-Slot Pair refers to the combination of a domain and a slot for which predictions are made in the model, such as 'hotel' and 'price range'."
"Slot Gate Classification is a part of the model that classifies whether a slot is active in a given context, using a cross-entropy loss function."
"Non-Categorical Slot-Value Prediction is the process of mapping slot values to spans in the dialog context, using token-level representations and a two-way linear mapping."
"Categorical Slot-Value Prediction involves predicting values for categorical slots from a list of candidate values, using a pre-trained BERT model and cosine similarity for relevance scoring."
"Learnable parameters used in the slot gate classification of the model."
"Bias term used in the slot gate classification of the model."
"The cross-entropy loss function used for slot gate classification."
"One-hot gate label for the jth domain-slot pair at the tth turn in slot gate classification."
"Start vector obtained from the two-way linear mapping for non-categorical slots."
"End vector obtained from the two-way linear mapping for non-categorical slots."
"Learnable parameters used in the two-way linear mapping for non-categorical slots."
"Bias term used in the two-way linear mapping for non-categorical slots."
"Probability of the ith word being the start position of the span in non-categorical slot-value prediction."
"Loss function for the start position prediction in non-categorical slot-value prediction."
"One-hot start position label for the jth domain-slot pair at the tth turn in non-categorical slot-value prediction."
"Loss function for the end position prediction in non-categorical slot-value prediction."
"Total loss for non-categorical slot-value prediction, summation of $\mathcal{L}_{s t a r t}$ and $\mathcal{L}_{e n d}$."
"Aggregated representation of each candidate value obtained from a separate pre-trained BERT model."
"Aggregated representation from the slot-context encoder used in the calculation of relevance score."

"Margin used in the hinge loss function to enlarge the difference between the similarity of $r_{t j}^{\mathrm{CLS}}$ to the target value and that to the most similar value in the candidate-value list."

entities.entity_name: "$\MATHCAL{L}_{P I C K L I S T}$"
entities.description: "Hinge loss function used to enlarge the difference between the similarity of $r_{t j}^{\mathrm{CLS}}$ to the target value and that to the most similar value in the candidate-value list."

relationships.description: "BERT is used as a feature extractor in the Slot Gate Classification part of the model."
"BERT provides token-level representations used in the Non-Categorical Slot-Value Prediction process."
"BERT is used to get aggregated representations of candidate values in Categorical Slot-Value Prediction."
"MultiWOZ 2.0 contains dialogues that are used to form Domain-Slot Pairs for the model."
"MultiWOZ 2.1 contains dialogues that are used to form Domain-Slot Pairs for the model."
"$W_{g a t e}$ is used in the calculation of the loss function $\mathcal{L}_{g a t e}$."

entities.description: "DS-DST is a method used for multi-domain dialog state tracking, which shows significant improvement over DS-Span in certain slots."

DS-Picklist is a proposed method that assumes a full ontology is available and treats all domain-slot pairs as categorical slots, finding values in a candidate-value list (picklist). It is similar to the work of Lee et al., 2019 and Chen et al., 2020.

DS-Span is a proposed method that treats all domain-slot pairs as noncategorical slots, extracting values through text spans with start and end positions in the dialog context. It is similar to the work of Xu and Hu (2018) and Gao et al. (2019b).
"MultiWOZ 2.1 is the test set used to evaluate the performance of dialog state tracking methods like DS-DST, DS-Picklist, and DS-Span."
"Noreen is referenced in the context of a statistical test used to determine the significance of differences in performance between dialog state tracking methods."
"Hotel-type is a slot in the dialog state tracking task where the type of hotel is determined, showing significant improvement for DS-DST and DS-Picklist over DS-Span."
"Attractiontype is a slot in the dialog state tracking task where the type of attraction is determined, showing significant improvement for DS-DST and DS-Picklist over DS-Span."
"Attraction-name is a slot in the dialog state tracking task where the name of the attraction is determined, showing significant improvement for DS-DST and DS-Picklist over DS-Span."
"Hotel-internet is a slot in the dialog state tracking task where the availability of internet in hotels is determined, showing significant improvement for DS-DST and DS-Picklist over DS-Span."
"Hotelparking is a slot in the dialog state tracking task where the availability of parking at hotels is determined, showing significant improvement for DS-DST and DS-Picklist over DS-Span."
"Taxi-leave at is a time-related slot in the dialog state tracking task where the time for a taxi to leave is determined, where DS-Span and DS-DST underperform."
"Trainarrive by is a time-related slot in the dialog state tracking task where the time for a train to arrive is determined, where DS-Span and DS-DST underperform."
"#Unfound refers to the number of slots whose values cannot be found through span matching in the dialog context, impacting the performance of DS-Span."
"#Relative_Turns refers to the number of dialogue turns where the slot type is mentioned, used to evaluate the performance of dialog state tracking methods."
"#Recover indicates the number of values correctly predicted by DS-DST or DS-Picklist, showing their effectiveness in predicting missing values."

relationships.description: "DS-DST is evaluated on the MultiWOZ 2.1 test set, showing significant improvement over the DS-Span baseline for certain slots."
"DS-Picklist is evaluated on the MultiWOZ 2.1 test set, showing significant improvement over the DS-Span baseline for certain slots."
"DS-Span is evaluated on the MultiWOZ 2.1 test set, where it underperforms compared to DS-DST and DS-Picklist in certain slots."
"Noreen's statistical test is used to evaluate the performance of DS-DST against DS-Span, indicating significant differences."
"Noreen's statistical test is used to evaluate the performance of DS-Span, showing it to be less effective than DS-DST and DS-Picklist."
"DS-DST shows significant improvement in predicting the hotel-type slot over DS-Span."
"DS-DST shows significant improvement in predicting the attractiontype slot over DS-Span."
"DS-DST shows significant improvement in predicting the attraction-name slot over DS-Span."
"DS-DST shows significant improvement in predicting the hotel-internet slot over DS-Span."
"DS-DST shows significant improvement in predicting the hotelparking slot over DS-Span."
"DS-DST underperforms in predicting the taxi-leave at slot due to lack of span matching in the dialogue context."
"DS-DST underperforms in predicting the trainarrive by slot due to lack of span matching in the dialogue context."

entities.description: "MultiWOZ 2.0 is a multi-domain dialogue corpus with seven distinct domains and over 10,000 dialogues."
"MultiWOZ 2.1 is an updated version of MultiWOZ 2.0 with dataset corrections, including dialog states, spelling errors, dialogue utterance corrections, and mis-annotations."
"Budzianowski et al., 2018 are the authors associated with the creation of the MultiWOZ 2.0 dataset."
"Eric et al., 2019 are the authors associated with the creation of the MultiWOZ 2.1 dataset and provided details on dataset corrections."
"Wu et al., 2019 are referenced for their work on ignoring hospital and police domains in experiments and for providing a data pre-processing script."
"Xu and Hu, 2018 are the authors of the SpanPtr model, which applies a RNN-based pointer network for finding text spans."
"Gao et al., 2019b are the authors of the DSTreader model, which models DST from the perspective of machine reading comprehensions."
"Zhou and Small, 2019 are the authors of the DSTQA model, which applies a dynamically-evolving knowledge graph for DST."
"Ren et al., 2019 are the authors of the COMER model, which applies BERT for generating slot sequences in the belief state."
"Rastogi et al., 2020 are the authors of the BERT-DST model, which uses BERT for schema element embeddings and dialogue state tracking."
"SpanPtr is a model that applies a RNN-based pointer network to find text spans with start and end pointers for each domain-slot pair."
"Ptr-DST is a variant of SpanPtr that deals with categorical slots, following the DS-DST approach."
"DSTreader is a model that models DST from the perspective of machine reading comprehensions and uses pre-trained BERT as initial word embeddings."
"DSTQA is a model that applies a dynamically-evolving knowledge graph and generates questions for the values of a domain-slot pair."
"TRADE is a model that contains a slot gate module for slots classification and a pointer generator for states generation."
"COMER is a model that applies BERT as contextualized word embeddings and generates slot sequences in the belief state, then value sequences for each slot."
"BERT-DST is a model that uses BERT to obtain schema element embeddings and encode system as well as user utterances for dialogue state tracking."
"Hospital domain is one of the domains in the MultiWOZ datasets, but it is ignored in the experiments due to a low number of dialogues."
"Police domain is another domain in the MultiWOZ datasets that is ignored in the experiments due to a low number of dialogues."
"Train domain is one of the five domains adopted in the experiments, focusing on dialogues related to train-related inquiries."
"Restaurant domain is one of the five domains adopted in the experiments, focusing on dialogues related to restaurant-related inquiries."
"Hotel domain is one of the five domains adopted in the experiments, focusing on dialogues related to hotel-related inquiries."
"Taxi domain is one of the five domains adopted in the experiments, focusing on dialogues related to taxi-related inquiries."
"Attraction domain is one of the five domains adopted in the experiments, focusing on dialogues related to attraction-related inquiries."
"Domain-slot pairs refer to the combination of domain-specific slots that are used in the dialogues for the purpose of dialogue state tracking."
"Dialogue state tracking is the process of identifying and tracking the state of a dialogue, which is a central task in the context of the MultiWOZ datasets."
"String matching is a technique used to find spans for non-categorical slots by comparing ground truth values with dialog contexts."
"Ontology refers to the partial or full schema that is used in dialogue state tracking to define the structure of the dialogues."
"SST-2 is a dataset mentioned in the text, though its specific relation to the other entities is not detailed in the provided text."
"Chen et al. are referenced in the text, but their specific contribution or relation to the other entities is not detailed in the provided text."

entities.description: "ERT is mentioned in the context of contextualized word embeddings and slot sequences generation in dialogue state tracking."
"BERT-DST is an event or model described by Rastogi et al., 2020, which uses BERT for schema element embeddings and dialogue state tracking with a pointer-generator copying mechanism."
"SST-2 is an event or model mentioned by Chen et al., 2020, which uses a graph neural network to incorporate slot relations and model slot interactions."
"DS-DST is a proposed dual strategy model for DST, capable of handling both non-categorical and categorical slots, following heuristics from Rastogi et al., 2020."

DS-Span is a proposed method that treats all domain-slot pairs as noncategorical slots, extracting values through text spans with start and end positions in the dialog context. It is similar to the work of Xu and Hu (2018) and Gao et al. (2019b).

DS-Picklist is a proposed method that assumes a full ontology is available and treats all domain-slot pairs as categorical slots, finding values in a candidate-value list (picklist). It is similar to the work of Lee et al., 2019 and Chen et al., 2020.
